definitions.text: a choice that is made by counting the number of people in favor of each alternative
examples: there were only 17 votes in favor of the motion
they allowed just one vote per person

definitions.text: the opinion of a group as determined by voting
examples: they put the question to a vote

definitions.text: a legal right guaranteed by the 15th amendment to the US Constitution; guaranteed to women by the 19th amendment
examples: American women got the vote in 1920

definitions.text: a body of voters who have the same interests
examples: he failed to get the Black vote

definitions.text: the total number of voters who participated
examples: they are expecting a large vote

definitions.text: express one's preference for a candidate or for a measure or resolution; cast a vote
examples: None of the Democrats voted last night

definitions.text: express one's choice or preference by vote

examples: I vote that we all go home
She voted for going to the Chinese restaurant

definitions.text: bring into existence or make available by vote
examples: They voted aid for the underdeveloped countries in Asia
